geninfo.para: Selected 36/38/47/4800 vehicles with 175 HP ST DT408/466 Engines (Codes 12NEA and 12NGA), built from August 24, 1994 through May 1, 1995, may experience poor engine performance after a short period of engine operation. This condition may be the result of the plunger spring seat in the fuel injection pump missing a heat treat process, resulting in critically low metal hardness and excessive wear.
To correct this condition, the suspect soft plunger spring seat must be replaced at an authorized Robert Bosch Warranty Repair Facility.

This condition impacts a small percentage of fuel injection pumps installed on vehicles with the DT408 and 466 engines built during this time period. The fuel injection pumps affected can be identified by part number and corresponding serial number. The following are part/serial numbers affected:
Fuel Injection Pump Part Number - 1823105C91 X or A
Fuel Injection Pump Serial Number Ranges: 467 000 5509 - 467 000 5820 and 467 000 9091 - 467 000 9360.
A complete list of VINs is attached to the paper version of this AFC.

step1.para: Verify pump part number and serial number are within the suspected range.

para.emph: Fuel pump R&R and timing procedures are explained in detail in the Engine Service Manual EGES-105 Section 11.

step1.para: Remove the fuel injection pump. Forward to an authorized Robert Bosch Warranty Repair Facility with accompanying CGE-351 warranty repair form. Make sure the repairing dealer understands the pump is eligible for a soft spring seat repair covered under AFC G-95907.
Re-install repaired fuel injection pump. Particular attention should be taken to insure fuel pump timing is set to the maximum allowable BTDC by specification.

laborinfo.para: Operation number must appear on all claims.

entry.para: Remove, re-install and set timing on fuel injection pump

claims.para: Expense is to be charged to Warranty. Claims are to be submitted in the normal manner, making reference to Authorized Field Change Number G-95907.

It is important that the coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to items 39 through 44.

To assure this important improvement is made in a timely manner, all claims for G-95907 activity must be submitted by June 30, 1996, or within the normal warranty period for the vehicle, if after June 30, 1996.
